Description: The explosion from a rifle shooting target containing Tannerite started a wildfire that burned 47,000 acres.
A 22-year-old woman was killed and eight others wounded after two men opened fire at a gender reveal party.
A Crop duster attempting to drop 350 gallons of coloured water for a gender-reveal crashed. The pilot was uninjured and passenger received minor injuries.
A 56-year-old woman was killed after being hit by debris from a home-made explosive device.
The pyrotechnic device used as part of a gender-reveal started a wildfire in Oak Glen, California. The wildfire burned 22,744 acres, destroyed 10 structures, and killed 1 firefighter.
A 26-year-old man was killed after being struck by debris from a small cannon-like device that exploded during a baby shower.
A father-to-be was killed and his younger brother injured after the accidental explosion of an in-development gender reveal device.
Two people were killed when a plane carrying a trailing sign that read "It's a girl!" crashed into the Caribbean Sea off the coast of Cancun, Mexico.
80 pounds (36kg) of Tannerite explosive detonated as part of a gender-reveal at a quarry caused damage to nearby buildings.
